carousel_items: Take Cellcept on an empty stomach, at least 1 hour before or 2 hours after a meal.
Don't be out in the sun for too long since you're more likely to get sunburned and increase the risk of skin cancer. Wear protective clothing and sunblock if you have to be out.
Cellcept can hurt or kill a fetus during pregnancy. Females of childbearing age must use two forms of birth control 4 weeks before, during, and 6 weeks after treatment.
Can cause stomach upset, headache, trouble sleeping, or affect your blood pressure, blood sugar, and cholesterol control.
Let your doctor know about any unusual bleeding, low energy, weakness, or flu-like symptoms.

basics.benefits_moa: Cellcept is an immunosuppresant that lowers the activity of your immune system, so it doesn't attack the transplanted organ.
basics.bottom_line: Cellcept is a good medication that prevents rejection of an organ transplant, but it can cause annoying stomach problems like diarrhea.
downsides: Regular blood tests are needed, especially in the beginning, to make sure Cellcept isn't affecting your body in a bad way.
Diarrhea is the main reason why people stop taking Cellcept.
If you're interested in becoming pregnant, you need to switch to a different medication since Cellcept can cause serious birth defects.
You may need to take another medicine to control your blood pressure, blood sugar, or cholesterol while on this.
Since it's an immunosuppressant, it can increase your risk of infections and certain cancers.

downsides_processed.orig: Regular blood tests are needed, especially in the beginning, to make sure Cellcept isn't affecting your body in a bad way.
Diarrhea is the main reason why people stop taking Cellcept.
If you're interested in becoming pregnant, you need to switch to a different medication since Cellcept can cause serious birth defects.
You may need to take another medicine to control your blood pressure, blood sugar, or cholesterol while on this.
Since it's an immunosuppressant, it can increase your risk of infections and certain cancers.

upsides: It's a first-choice medication for preventing organ rejection since it doesn't hurt the kidneys or liver like other medications in its class.
Can often be used by itself to prevent rejection without using more complicated medications like steroids or Tacrolimus.
However, survival rates are the highest and rejection is the lowest when Cellcept is used with other medications to prevent transplant rejection.

upsides_processed.orig: It's a first-choice medication for preventing organ rejection since it doesn't hurt the kidneys or liver like other medications in its class.
Can often be used by itself to prevent rejection without using more complicated medications like steroids or Tacrolimus.
However, survival rates are the highest and rejection is the lowest when Cellcept is used with other medications to prevent transplant rejection.

drugs.name: Cellcept

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take Cellcept on an empty stomach, at least 1 hour before or 2 hours after a meal.
Don't be out in the sun for too long since you're more likely to get sunburned and increase the risk of skin cancer. Wear protective clothing and sunblock if you have to be out.
Cellcept can hurt or kill a fetus during pregnancy. Females of childbearing age must use two forms of birth control 4 weeks before, during, and 6 weeks after treatment.
Can cause stomach upset, headache, trouble sleeping, or affect your blood pressure, blood sugar, and cholesterol control.
Let your doctor know about any unusual bleeding, low energy, weakness, or flu-like symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Cellcept can cause serious birth defects in a fetus. Don't use Cellcept while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Cellcept can cause serious birth defects in a fetus. Don't use Cellcept while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

risks_warnings.title: Serious infections
risks_warnings.description: Cellcept can increase your risk of serious or life-threatening bacterial, fungal, and viral infections. In some cases, infections can be reactivated from an inactive virus in your body like tuberculosis (TB) or hepatitis B virus (HBV). If you develop symptoms of fever, chills, muscle aches, or you notice dark urine, appetite/weight loss, vomiting, or a skin rash, tell your doctor and get medical care right away.

description_processed.orig: Cellcept can increase your risk of serious or life-threatening bacterial, fungal, and viral infections. In some cases, infections can be reactivated from an inactive virus in your body like tuberculosis (TB) or hepatitis B virus (HBV). If you develop symptoms of fever, chills, muscle aches, or you notice dark urine, appetite/weight loss, vomiting, or a skin rash, tell your doctor and get medical care right away.

risks_warnings.title: Blood disorders
risks_warnings.description: Cellcept can lower white blood cell counts, the cells that help your body fight infections. It can also cause pure red cell aplasia (PRCA), a type of anemia. Tell your doctor if you have any infection symptoms (such as fever, sore throat, or mouth/throat swelling) that don't go away.

description_processed.orig: Cellcept can lower white blood cell counts, the cells that help your body fight infections. It can also cause pure red cell aplasia (PRCA), a type of anemia. Tell your doctor if you have any infection symptoms (such as fever, sore throat, or mouth/throat swelling) that don't go away.

risks_warnings.title: Cancer
risks_warnings.description: Long-term use of Cellcept has been reported to cause skin cancer, as well as lymphoma (a cancer of the lymph nodes, which protect our bodies from infection and toxins).

description_processed.orig: Long-term use of Cellcept has been reported to cause skin cancer, as well as lymphoma (a cancer of the lymph nodes, which protect our bodies from infection and toxins).

carousel_items: Enbrel is available as a single-use prefilled syringe, single-use prefilled SureClick Autoinjector, and multiple-use vial. You and your doctor can discuss which is best for you.
The autoinjector can be stored at room temperature for up to 14 days and can't be refrigerated again.
Enbrel is a medication that's injected under the skin (subcutaneous). Your doctor can give you your first dose, then let you self-inject it once so you learn how to do it correctly.
Enbrel lowers the your immune system's ability to fight infections, so it's important to let your doctor know if you come down with a fever, cough, or notice flu-like symptoms.
You'll need to have a TB test before you start using Enbrel.
Tell your doctor if you have an allergy to latex since the syringe needle cover has latex in it.
Don't inject Enbrel into skin that's red, bruised, or irritated. Rotate your injection areas to avoid skin reactions.
As with all injection medicines, store away from children and throw used syringes away in a protective container, and not in the trash.

basics.benefits_moa: Enbrel is a biologic response modifier. It works in the immune system to block a protein called TNF (tumor necrosis factor). Blocking TNF relieves symptoms and prevents disease progression.
basics.bottom_line: Enbrel is very effective at calming down your immune system, but it's expensive, you have to take into account the hassle of injections and traveling with the medication.
downsides: It's an injection.
It's expensive because there's no generic available yet.

Enbrel lowers your ability to fight infection and can cause serious life-threatening illness. The risk is greater if you take other drugs that lower your immune system, have an active infection, diabetes, or had tuberculosis (TB) in the past.

You're first dose of Enbrel will need to be given at your doctor's office. If you decide not to self-inject and don't have someone to do it for you, you'll need to continue to see your doctor for each dose.
You'll need to properly dispose of the needle, syringes, or Pen in a special (FDA-approved) sharps container.
Because it needs to be refrigerated until you use it, if you're traveling, you'll need to carry it in a cooler with an ice pack.

downsides_processed.orig: It's an injection.
It's expensive because there's no generic available yet.

Enbrel lowers your ability to fight infection and can cause serious life-threatening illness. The risk is greater if you take other drugs that lower your immune system, have an active infection, diabetes, or had tuberculosis (TB) in the past.

You're first dose of Enbrel will need to be given at your doctor's office. If you decide not to self-inject and don't have someone to do it for you, you'll need to continue to see your doctor for each dose.
You'll need to properly dispose of the needle, syringes, or Pen in a special (FDA-approved) sharps container.
Because it needs to be refrigerated until you use it, if you're traveling, you'll need to carry it in a cooler with an ice pack.

upsides: Treats certain types of arthritis conditions caused by an overactive immune system.
Enbrel is the first biologic approved for moderate to severe rheumatoid arthritis.
It has an established safety profile for treatment of rheumatoid arthritis (RA).
Available as a single-use syringe and SureClick auto-injector pen which may be more convenient and easier for some people to use.
People taking Enbrel for rheumatoid arthritis showed significant improvement and were able to reduce the dose or stop immunosuppressant medicines.

upsides_processed.orig: Treats certain types of arthritis conditions caused by an overactive immune system.
Enbrel is the first biologic approved for moderate to severe rheumatoid arthritis.
It has an established safety profile for treatment of rheumatoid arthritis (RA).
Available as a single-use syringe and SureClick auto-injector pen which may be more convenient and easier for some people to use.
People taking Enbrel for rheumatoid arthritis showed significant improvement and were able to reduce the dose or stop immunosuppressant medicines.

userStories.tip: Travelling with Enbrel is easy. TSA won't bug you at all.

If you sit with an ice pack on your thigh before injections the pain and bruises aren't so bad. Takes about 6 months to work. I went from hobbling in the mornings to a little yoga before a solid 3 miles on the treadmill.
It doesn't take long to get used to giving yourself injections. After the adjustment period, it's wonderful!
When injecting in the thigh, there is a "sweet spot" where it is less painful...I am still trying to get it on that spot each time but I can't seem to get it right.
Make sure to use the Enbrel support system. It gives you free access to Registered Nurses and supplies sharps containers, little cooler, and alcohol wipes.
userStories.identifier: Just a guy with ankylosing spondylitis

userStories.tip: Try it if you have been going through the regimen of stronger and stronger NSAID's and seeing weaker relief. Which is what happened with me.  Biologics are the end of the line. A shot a week. No problems.
it was the only drug that worked- but after a while .....nothing

drugs.name: Enbrel

carousel_items_processed.orig: Enbrel is available as a single-use prefilled syringe, single-use prefilled SureClick Autoinjector, and multiple-use vial. You and your doctor can discuss which is best for you.
The autoinjector can be stored at room temperature for up to 14 days and can't be refrigerated again.
Enbrel is a medication that's injected under the skin (subcutaneous). Your doctor can give you your first dose, then let you self-inject it once so you learn how to do it correctly.
Enbrel lowers the your immune system's ability to fight infections, so it's important to let your doctor know if you come down with a fever, cough, or notice flu-like symptoms.
You'll need to have a TB test before you start using Enbrel.
Tell your doctor if you have an allergy to latex since the syringe needle cover has latex in it.
Don't inject Enbrel into skin that's red, bruised, or irritated. Rotate your injection areas to avoid skin reactions.
As with all injection medicines, store away from children and throw used syringes away in a protective container, and not in the trash.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Enbrel has been reported to cause hypersensitivity reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing) and angioedema (life-threatening condition with swelling with or without hives). If you notice these symptoms after your dose or days later, call your doctor and get medical care right away.

description_processed.orig: Enbrel has been reported to cause hypersensitivity reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing) and angioedema (life-threatening condition with swelling with or without hives). If you notice these symptoms after your dose or days later, call your doctor and get medical care right away.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Enbrel may not be the best choice if you have advanced heart failure with symptoms. If you have mild heart failure and your condition hasn't improved on any other medicine talk to your doctor to see if Enbrel is right for you. You may have to take lower doses and have heart testing before  and during treatment.

description_processed.orig: Enbrel may not be the best choice if you have advanced heart failure with symptoms. If you have mild heart failure and your condition hasn't improved on any other medicine talk to your doctor to see if Enbrel is right for you. You may have to take lower doses and have heart testing before  and during treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Serious infections
risks_warnings.description: Enbrel can increase your risk of serious or life-threatening bacterial, fungal and viral infections. In some cases infections can be reactivated from an inactive virus in your body like tuberculosis (TB) or hepatitis B virus (HBV). You may need to take medicine for TB before you can begin taking Enbrel. If you develop symptoms of cough, fever, chills, muscle aches, feel very tired, or you notice dark urine, yellowing of skin/eyes, appetite/weight loss, vomiting, change in stool color, stomach discomfort, and skin rash,  tell your doctor and get medical care right away.

description_processed.orig: Enbrel can increase your risk of serious or life-threatening bacterial, fungal and viral infections. In some cases infections can be reactivated from an inactive virus in your body like tuberculosis (TB) or hepatitis B virus (HBV). You may need to take medicine for TB before you can begin taking Enbrel. If you develop symptoms of cough, fever, chills, muscle aches, feel very tired, or you notice dark urine, yellowing of skin/eyes, appetite/weight loss, vomiting, change in stool color, stomach discomfort, and skin rash,  tell your doctor and get medical care right away.

risks_warnings.title: Malignancy
risks_warnings.description: Based on how Enbrel works, it may lower the body's defenses against malignancies and control how they develop and grow. There appears to be a higher risk of lymphoma, some other cancers, and non-melanoma skin cancer (NMSC) in people who take Enbrel.

description_processed.orig: Based on how Enbrel works, it may lower the body's defenses against malignancies and control how they develop and grow. There appears to be a higher risk of lymphoma, some other cancers, and non-melanoma skin cancer (NMSC) in people who take Enbrel.

risks_warnings.title: Nervous system effects
risks_warnings.description: Although rare, Enbrel can cause nervous system conditions such as multiple sclerosis (MS) and Guillain Barre syndrome. If you currently have a nervous system condition, your doctor will watch you closely while your taking Enbrel since it can make them worse. Let your doctor know right away if you notice numbness or tingling, weakness in arms or legs, vision problems or dizziness.

description_processed.orig: Although rare, Enbrel can cause nervous system conditions such as multiple sclerosis (MS) and Guillain Barre syndrome. If you currently have a nervous system condition, your doctor will watch you closely while your taking Enbrel since it can make them worse. Let your doctor know right away if you notice numbness or tingling, weakness in arms or legs, vision problems or dizziness.

risks_warnings.title: Blood problems
risks_warnings.description: Enbrel can affect blood cells that help you fight infection and stop bleeding. Let your doctor know if you develop a fever that doesn't go away, or you easily bruise, or bleed. You may need to stop taking this medicine.

description_processed.orig: Enbrel can affect blood cells that help you fight infection and stop bleeding. Let your doctor know if you develop a fever that doesn't go away, or you easily bruise, or bleed. You may need to stop taking this medicine.

points.name: Pyrexia
points.dosage: In general, the adverse reactions in pediatric patients were similar in frequency and type as those seen in adult patients

carousel_items: The dose and duration on how long you need the medicine depends on your condition and response.
Take it exactly as your doctor prescribed.
Take with food to decrease stomach upset.
Can cause trouble sleeping. Take in the morning or 2-3 hours before bed if more than one dose is needed.
Can cause changes in mood, blood pressure, blood sugar, and water retention.
You should check your blood pressure and blood sugar when taking this medicine if you already have high blood pressure or diabetes.
A taper is is often needed to stop the medicine, especially if you've been on it for more than 1 week.

clock.tip: Works better if taken with a high-fat meal.

basics.benefits_moa: Prednisone is a corticosteroid that's similar to what your body naturally makes. It reduces swelling and other immune responses that can cause you pain, discomfort, or harm.
basics.bottom_line: Prednisone is a common oral corticosteroid that's great for controlling the unwanted symptoms from your immune responses and will make you feel better. There are lots of side effects but most of are tolerable or can be managed.
downsides: Lots of side effects, especially with long term use.
Short-term use can cause mood changes, trouble sleeping and increase in blood pressure, blood sugar, and possible water retention.
Long-term use can cause problems with skin, bone, eye health and put you at a higher risk for infections.
People with certain conditions will have to pay extra attention to their symptoms or may have to adjust the dose of other medicines when taking Prednisone.
When using corticosteroids for more than 1 week, you will need to work with a doctor to get off the medicine slowly.
Only available as an oral medicine so the rest of your body will be exposed to the medicine.

downsides_processed.orig: Lots of side effects, especially with long term use.
Short-term use can cause mood changes, trouble sleeping and increase in blood pressure, blood sugar, and possible water retention.
Long-term use can cause problems with skin, bone, eye health and put you at a higher risk for infections.
People with certain conditions will have to pay extra attention to their symptoms or may have to adjust the dose of other medicines when taking Prednisone.
When using corticosteroids for more than 1 week, you will need to work with a doctor to get off the medicine slowly.
Only available as an oral medicine so the rest of your body will be exposed to the medicine.

upsides: Steroid magic, can help you feel better, have more energy and get more appetite.
Useful for many conditions.
Short-term use in controlling immune responses that are causing you discomfort, and works quickly to relieve symptoms like swelling, rash, asthma attacks, gout attacks.
Long-term use in suppressing the immune system from causing your body harm, like many autoimmune related conditions.

upsides_processed.orig: Steroid magic, can help you feel better, have more energy and get more appetite.
Useful for many conditions.
Short-term use in controlling immune responses that are causing you discomfort, and works quickly to relieve symptoms like swelling, rash, asthma attacks, gout attacks.
Long-term use in suppressing the immune system from causing your body harm, like many autoimmune related conditions.

userStories.tip: I have taken Prednisone on and off as low dose therapy to control Lupus and MS, but it caused a sandpaper rash all over my arms and face so doctor terminated the treatment. Weight gain was a definite issue for me.
Made my foot cramp and fall asleep. Also blurred vision!

SO SO hard to come off of...autoimmune chronic inflammatory issue--the rebound effect is vicious, and coming off prednisone makes me suicidal and want to self harm. Staying on prednisone makes me retain water and become hyper irritable.
Caused weight loss, muscle wasting and thinning of the bones
Never take on an empty stomach. Take the lowest dosage that is effective.
It has many more side effects than it's worth.. : /

userStories.identifier: Parent, work out when I can

drugs.name: Prednisone

labeled_indications.indication: Cerebral edema from a brain tumor or head injury

carousel_items_processed.orig: The dose and duration on how long you need the medicine depends on your condition and response.
Take it exactly as your doctor prescribed.
Take with food to decrease stomach upset.
Can cause trouble sleeping. Take in the morning or 2-3 hours before bed if more than one dose is needed.
Can cause changes in mood, blood pressure, blood sugar, and water retention.
You should check your blood pressure and blood sugar when taking this medicine if you already have high blood pressure or diabetes.
A taper is is often needed to stop the medicine, especially if you've been on it for more than 1 week.

risks_warnings.title: Adrenal suppression (HPA axis suppression)
risks_warnings.description: Adrenal suppression leading to adrenal crisis can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Prednisone too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your Prednisone dose need to be done slowly over time. Talk to your doctor before you make any changes or stop the medication.
risk_factors: Lowering dose or stopping too quickly especially after long-term treatment
Stress such as trauma, surgery or infection

description_processed.orig: Adrenal suppression leading to adrenal crisis can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Prednisone too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your Prednisone dose need to be done slowly over time. Talk to your doctor before you make any changes or stop the medication.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk for infections
risks_warnings.description: If you take Prednisone for a long time it can increase your risk of all types of infections, make it hard to tell if you have one, take longer to fight and be more serious. Be careful not to be in contact with anyone who has the chicken pox or measles. If you had tuberculosis (TB) in the past your doctor will need to monitor you while taking Prednisone. You may need to take medicine to prevent getting it or treat it if your TB comes back. Talk to your doctor before taking Prednisone if you haven't had vaccinations against certain viral diseases, are under stress or regularly around sick people.
risk_factors: Contact with people who have viral illness
History of bacterial or viral conditions

description_processed.orig: If you take Prednisone for a long time it can increase your risk of all types of infections, make it hard to tell if you have one, take longer to fight and be more serious. Be careful not to be in contact with anyone who has the chicken pox or measles. If you had tuberculosis (TB) in the past your doctor will need to monitor you while taking Prednisone. You may need to take medicine to prevent getting it or treat it if your TB comes back. Talk to your doctor before taking Prednisone if you haven't had vaccinations against certain viral diseases, are under stress or regularly around sick people.

risks_warnings.title: Kaposi's sarcoma
risks_warnings.description: It’s rare, but taking Prednisone for a long period of time, can increase your risk of Kaposi’s sarcoma, a type of cancer that can affect both the skin and internal organs. Your doctor will monitor you closely while you're taking Prednisone and if this develops, will work with you to slowly lower your dose and stop the medication.

description_processed.orig: It’s rare, but taking Prednisone for a long period of time, can increase your risk of Kaposi’s sarcoma, a type of cancer that can affect both the skin and internal organs. Your doctor will monitor you closely while you're taking Prednisone and if this develops, will work with you to slowly lower your dose and stop the medication.

risks_warnings.title: Eye problems
risks_warnings.description: Prednisone may cause cataracts or glaucoma, increased eye pressure and possibly eye nerve damage. You may also be more at risk for certain eye infections. Don't take if you have herpes simplex of the eye.  Let your doctor know if you have blurry vision, eye pain or any vision changes.

description_processed.orig: Prednisone may cause cataracts or glaucoma, increased eye pressure and possibly eye nerve damage. You may also be more at risk for certain eye infections. Don't take if you have herpes simplex of the eye.  Let your doctor know if you have blurry vision, eye pain or any vision changes.

risks_warnings.title: Psychiatric changes
risks_warnings.description: Like most corticosteroid medicines, Prednisone may cause changes in your mood or behavior. Tell your doctor right away if you become depressed, have mood swings, trouble sleeping, irritability or anxiety, hyperactivity,  delusions or hallucinations while taking this medicine. If you need to make any changes or slowly taper your dose, talk to your doctor first.

description_processed.orig: Like most corticosteroid medicines, Prednisone may cause changes in your mood or behavior. Tell your doctor right away if you become depressed, have mood swings, trouble sleeping, irritability or anxiety, hyperactivity,  delusions or hallucinations while taking this medicine. If you need to make any changes or slowly taper your dose, talk to your doctor first.

risks_warnings.title: Bone effects
risks_warnings.description: Prednisone can thin the bones and decrease the growth rate in children. Talk to the doctor about medicine choices that won't negatively affect growth. Use the lowest possible dose to treat the condition and have the doctor monitor your child’s height during treatment.

description_processed.orig: Prednisone can thin the bones and decrease the growth rate in children. Talk to the doctor about medicine choices that won't negatively affect growth. Use the lowest possible dose to treat the condition and have the doctor monitor your child’s height during treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Taking Prednisone if your pregnant or breast-feeding can harm your unborn baby. If you need to take a systemic corticosteroid during pregnancy, the lowest dose that will help treat your condition should be used for the shortest time, especially during your first trimester. Your doctor will let you know if there are other medicine choices that are safer (e.g. inhaled steroids for asthma). If you're taking Prednisone to treat an autoimmune condition like rheumatoid arthritis or for antirejection treatment after a transplant, there are disease registries that you'll need to contact so make sure you talk to your doctor.

description_processed.orig: Taking Prednisone if your pregnant or breast-feeding can harm your unborn baby. If you need to take a systemic corticosteroid during pregnancy, the lowest dose that will help treat your condition should be used for the shortest time, especially during your first trimester. Your doctor will let you know if there are other medicine choices that are safer (e.g. inhaled steroids for asthma). If you're taking Prednisone to treat an autoimmune condition like rheumatoid arthritis or for antirejection treatment after a transplant, there are disease registries that you'll need to contact so make sure you talk to your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach and intestinal problems
risks_warnings.description: Taking Prednisone increases the risk of injury to the lining of your stomach and intestine including irritation, tears/holes and ulcers. You should avoid alcohol/alcoholic beverages because it can worsen stomach irritation. Tell your doctor or get medical care right away if you have stomach pain, notice blood or dark colored stools when you go to the bathroom.
risk_factors: Active or history of stomach or duodenal ulcers
Taking Prednisone with other medicine that can cause stomach problems

description_processed.orig: Taking Prednisone increases the risk of injury to the lining of your stomach and intestine including irritation, tears/holes and ulcers. You should avoid alcohol/alcoholic beverages because it can worsen stomach irritation. Tell your doctor or get medical care right away if you have stomach pain, notice blood or dark colored stools when you go to the bathroom.

points.name: Congestive heart failure in susceptible patients
Aseptic necrosis of femoral and humeral heads
Peptic ulcer with possible perforation and hemorrhage
May suppress reactions to skin tests
Negative nitrogen balance due to protein

carousel_items: Immediate-release capsules can be taken with or without food, just be consistent in how you take it. Extended-release capsules should be taken on an empty stomach, 1 hour before or 2 hours after food.
When getting a transplant, you'll be given several medications. To reduce side effects and interactions, be sure to tell your doctor about any other medications or vitamins you're taking.

Tacrolimus and other immunosuppressants can lower your body's ability to fight infection. It's important that you practice good hygiene, avoid close contact with people who are sick, wear gloves when you garden, keep any cuts clean and covered, and avoid sharing towels or sponges.
Don't be out in the sun for too long since you're more likely to get sunburned and increase the risk of skin cancer. Wear protective clothing and sunblock if you have to be out.
Let your doctor know about any flu-like symptoms, muscle weakness or cramps, irregular heart beat, changes in eyesight, or if you're not urinating like you normally do.

basics.benefits_moa: Tacrolimus is an immunosuppresant that lowers the activity of your immune system, so it doesn't attack the transplanted organ.
basics.bottom_line: Tacrolimus is a good medication that prevents rejection of an organ transplant, but there are a lot of rules to follow while taking it.
downsides: Regular blood tests are needed, especially in the beginning, to make sure Tacrolimus isn't affecting your body in a bad way.
20% of patients need insulin to control their blood sugar while taking Tacrolimus.
Comes with potentially serious side effects like kidney damage, seizures, tremor, and hallucinations.
You'll likely need to take corticosteroids with Tacrolimus.
Similar immunosuppressant medications can have fewer side effects.
Tacrolimus, like all immunosuppressants increases your risk of infection and certain cancers.

downsides_processed.orig: Regular blood tests are needed, especially in the beginning, to make sure Tacrolimus isn't affecting your body in a bad way.
20% of patients need insulin to control their blood sugar while taking Tacrolimus.
Comes with potentially serious side effects like kidney damage, seizures, tremor, and hallucinations.
You'll likely need to take corticosteroids with Tacrolimus.
Similar immunosuppressant medications can have fewer side effects.
Tacrolimus, like all immunosuppressants increases your risk of infection and certain cancers.

upsides: 96% of patients using Tacrolimus maintained healthy organ transplants.
Can be taken by mouth within 24 hours of a transplant, helping reduce the complications of a lengthy hospital stay.
Patients taking Tacrolimus had fewer heart problems than those taking similar medications.
Comes as an extended-release capsule, so it can be taken just once a day.
Tacrolimus doesn't cause hirsutism (unexpected hair growth) or gum overgrowth like Cyclosporine.

upsides_processed.orig: 96% of patients using Tacrolimus maintained healthy organ transplants.
Can be taken by mouth within 24 hours of a transplant, helping reduce the complications of a lengthy hospital stay.
Patients taking Tacrolimus had fewer heart problems than those taking similar medications.
Comes as an extended-release capsule, so it can be taken just once a day.
Tacrolimus doesn't cause hirsutism (unexpected hair growth) or gum overgrowth like Cyclosporine.

userStories.tip: Prograf does cause tremors in my hands - nothing noticeable - but enough that I can no longer do my own nails. The benefits far exceed that one drawback for me.
Replacing ciclosporin with this stopped my gum growth, Be very strict re timing - 12 hour intervals, capsules are small, check baseline glucose levels.

drugs.name: Prograf

carousel_items_processed.orig: Immediate-release capsules can be taken with or without food, just be consistent in how you take it. Extended-release capsules should be taken on an empty stomach, 1 hour before or 2 hours after food.
When getting a transplant, you'll be given several medications. To reduce side effects and interactions, be sure to tell your doctor about any other medications or vitamins you're taking.

Tacrolimus and other immunosuppressants can lower your body's ability to fight infection. It's important that you practice good hygiene, avoid close contact with people who are sick, wear gloves when you garden, keep any cuts clean and covered, and avoid sharing towels or sponges.
Don't be out in the sun for too long since you're more likely to get sunburned and increase the risk of skin cancer. Wear protective clothing and sunblock if you have to be out.
Let your doctor know about any flu-like symptoms, muscle weakness or cramps, irregular heart beat, changes in eyesight, or if you're not urinating like you normally do.

risks_warnings.title: Serious infections
risks_warnings.description: Tacrolimus can increase your risk of serious or life-threatening bacterial, fungal, and viral infections. In some cases, infections can be reactivated from an inactive virus in your body like tuberculosis (TB) or hepatitis B virus (HBV). If you develop symptoms of fever, chills, muscle aches, or you notice dark urine, appetite/weight loss, vomiting, or a skin rash, tell your doctor and get medical care right away.

description_processed.orig: Tacrolimus can increase your risk of serious or life-threatening bacterial, fungal, and viral infections. In some cases, infections can be reactivated from an inactive virus in your body like tuberculosis (TB) or hepatitis B virus (HBV). If you develop symptoms of fever, chills, muscle aches, or you notice dark urine, appetite/weight loss, vomiting, or a skin rash, tell your doctor and get medical care right away.

risks_warnings.title: Cancer
risks_warnings.description: Long-term use of Tacrolimus has been reported to cause skin cancer, as well as lymphoma (a cancer of the lymph nodes, which protect our bodies from infection and toxins).

description_processed.orig: Long-term use of Tacrolimus has been reported to cause skin cancer, as well as lymphoma (a cancer of the lymph nodes, which protect our bodies from infection and toxins).

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Tacrolimus can cause an irregular heartbeat. It can also increase your risk risk of thickened heart muscles (preventing your heart from working properly). Your doctor may test your heart and blood before starting treatment. If the heart problems are serious, your doctor may stop Tacrolimus.

description_processed.orig: Tacrolimus can cause an irregular heartbeat. It can also increase your risk risk of thickened heart muscles (preventing your heart from working properly). Your doctor may test your heart and blood before starting treatment. If the heart problems are serious, your doctor may stop Tacrolimus.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach or intestine damage
risks_warnings.description: Tacrolimus can cause a hole to develop in your stomach or intestine. Talk to your doctor if you experience pain in your abdomen, nausea, vomiting, constipation, or fever.

description_processed.orig: Tacrolimus can cause a hole to develop in your stomach or intestine. Talk to your doctor if you experience pain in your abdomen, nausea, vomiting, constipation, or fever.

risks_warnings.title: Diabetes
risks_warnings.description: Tacrolimus can increase your risk of diabetes. If you are at risk, you'll need to monitor your blood glucose levels often. There's a higher risk for African-American and Hispanic kidney transplant patients.

description_processed.orig: Tacrolimus can increase your risk of diabetes. If you are at risk, you'll need to monitor your blood glucose levels often. There's a higher risk for African-American and Hispanic kidney transplant patients.

risks_warnings.title: Kidney damage
risks_warnings.description: Kidney damage can occur when Tacrolimus is used in high doses, especially in patients with impaired kidney function, or with other damaging (nephrotoxic) drugs like Sirolimus, Cyclosporine.

description_processed.orig: Kidney damage can occur when Tacrolimus is used in high doses, especially in patients with impaired kidney function, or with other damaging (nephrotoxic) drugs like Sirolimus, Cyclosporine.

carousel_items: Rituximab is given as an IV infusion by trained medical staff in a clinic or hospital.
You'll need to be monitored in the clinic in case you have a serious or life-threatening reaction during the infusion, but you can take other medications that'll lower your risk of this happening.
It's very important that you read the Medication Guide before you start taking Rituximab.
Rituximab lowers your immune system's ability to fight infections, so it's important to let your doctor know if you notice a fever, a cough that doesn't go away, or flu-like symptoms.
Use effective birth control while you're taking Rituximab and for 12 months after you finish treatment.
Don't get live vaccines while you're taking Rituximab.

basics.benefits_moa: Rituximab is a monoclonal antibody. It targets a specific protein on white blood cells that makes it easier for your immune system to find and destroy cancerous cells. It also relieves symptoms and slows the progression of Rheumatoid Arthritis.
basics.bottom_line: Rituximab is effective for treating multiple types of cancer and arthritis. That said, you'll need to watch for possibly serious side effects, especially infusion reactions.
downsides: Only your doctor or other trained medical staff can administer Rituximab, so you'll need to go into an office or clinic for every dose.
Not the best choice if you have heart problems.
Rituximab can stay in your body for up to 6 months after you complete treatment. Men and women who are able to have children need to use birth control for up to one year after finishing Rituximab.
Discuss with your doctor the serious heart, kidney, liver, or stomach problems that can happen while on Rituximab.

downsides_processed.orig: Only your doctor or other trained medical staff can administer Rituximab, so you'll need to go into an office or clinic for every dose.
Not the best choice if you have heart problems.
Rituximab can stay in your body for up to 6 months after you complete treatment. Men and women who are able to have children need to use birth control for up to one year after finishing Rituximab.
Discuss with your doctor the serious heart, kidney, liver, or stomach problems that can happen while on Rituximab.

upsides: Treats leukemia, lymphoma, and blood vessel inflammation.
Also treats moderate to severe rheumatoid arthritis that hasn't responded to anti-TNF treatment (but you'll need to take methotrexate too).

The chance of having a reaction to the infusion is highest during your first dose, but the risk decreases each time you get Rituximab. It usually happens within 30 minutes to 2 hours after starting the infusion.
Rituximab is a targeted therapy that works differently than chemotherapy. Both work well when they're taken together, especially when treating CLL and NHL.

upsides_processed.orig: Treats leukemia, lymphoma, and blood vessel inflammation.
Also treats moderate to severe rheumatoid arthritis that hasn't responded to anti-TNF treatment (but you'll need to take methotrexate too).

The chance of having a reaction to the infusion is highest during your first dose, but the risk decreases each time you get Rituximab. It usually happens within 30 minutes to 2 hours after starting the infusion.
Rituximab is a targeted therapy that works differently than chemotherapy. Both work well when they're taken together, especially when treating CLL and NHL.

drugs.name: Rituxan

carousel_items_processed.orig: Rituximab is given as an IV infusion by trained medical staff in a clinic or hospital.
You'll need to be monitored in the clinic in case you have a serious or life-threatening reaction during the infusion, but you can take other medications that'll lower your risk of this happening.
It's very important that you read the Medication Guide before you start taking Rituximab.
Rituximab lowers your immune system's ability to fight infections, so it's important to let your doctor know if you notice a fever, a cough that doesn't go away, or flu-like symptoms.
Use effective birth control while you're taking Rituximab and for 12 months after you finish treatment.
Don't get live vaccines while you're taking Rituximab.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Serious infusion reactions can occur at the time Rituximab is given and within 24 hours. Tell your doctor or get medical help right away if  you notice itching, sudden cough, dizziness, racing heartbeat, chest pain, or  angioedema (life-threatening condition with swelling with or without hives). Your doctor can prescribe medication before your dose so the risk of having this happen is less.

description_processed.orig: Serious infusion reactions can occur at the time Rituximab is given and within 24 hours. Tell your doctor or get medical help right away if  you notice itching, sudden cough, dizziness, racing heartbeat, chest pain, or  angioedema (life-threatening condition with swelling with or without hives). Your doctor can prescribe medication before your dose so the risk of having this happen is less.

risks_warnings.title: Serious infections
risks_warnings.description: Rituximab can increase your risk of serious or life-threatening bacterial, fungal and viral infections including sepsis. In some cases infections can be reactivated from an inactive virus in your body like tuberculosis (TB) or hepatitis B virus (HBV). You may need to take medicine for TB before you can begin taking Rituximab. If you develop symptoms of cough, fever, chills, muscle aches, feel very tired, or you notice dark urine, yellowing of skin/eyes, appetite/weight loss, vomiting, change in stool color, stomach discomfort, and skin rash,  tell your doctor and get medical care right away.

description_processed.orig: Rituximab can increase your risk of serious or life-threatening bacterial, fungal and viral infections including sepsis. In some cases infections can be reactivated from an inactive virus in your body like tuberculosis (TB) or hepatitis B virus (HBV). You may need to take medicine for TB before you can begin taking Rituximab. If you develop symptoms of cough, fever, chills, muscle aches, feel very tired, or you notice dark urine, yellowing of skin/eyes, appetite/weight loss, vomiting, change in stool color, stomach discomfort, and skin rash,  tell your doctor and get medical care right away.

risks_warnings.title: Nervous system effects
risks_warnings.description: Although rare, Rituximab can cause Progressive Multifocal Leukoencephalopathy (PML), a serious often fatal brain infection caused by a virus. Unfortunately, it can't be prevented or treated, and if you get it, there's no cure. Let your doctor know right away if you become confused, dizzy, have vision problems, loss of balance or weakness on one side of your body
risk_factors: Taking Rituximab with immunosuppressant drugs (if using for RA)
Taking Rituximab with chemotherapy (if using for NHL or CLL

description_processed.orig: Although rare, Rituximab can cause Progressive Multifocal Leukoencephalopathy (PML), a serious often fatal brain infection caused by a virus. Unfortunately, it can't be prevented or treated, and if you get it, there's no cure. Let your doctor know right away if you become confused, dizzy, have vision problems, loss of balance or weakness on one side of your body

risks_warnings.title: Skin and mouth reactions
risks_warnings.description: Severe and possibly fatal reactions (e.g. Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis, pemphigus)  can happen anytime and as early as the first day while taking Rituximab. Tell your doctor or get medical help right away if you notice sores or fluid-filled blisters on your skin, lips or inside your mouth or peeling skin that's painful. You may not be able to re-start Rituximab after this reaction.

description_processed.orig: Severe and possibly fatal reactions (e.g. Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis, pemphigus)  can happen anytime and as early as the first day while taking Rituximab. Tell your doctor or get medical help right away if you notice sores or fluid-filled blisters on your skin, lips or inside your mouth or peeling skin that's painful. You may not be able to re-start Rituximab after this reaction.

risks_warnings.title: Kidney injury
risks_warnings.description: Tumor lysis syndrome (TLS) happens when cancer cells are broken down very quickly and damage the kidneys. The damage can be so bad that people need dialysis. If you're taking Rituximab for a cancer condition your doctor can give you medicines and take measures to prevent this reaction.

description_processed.orig: Tumor lysis syndrome (TLS) happens when cancer cells are broken down very quickly and damage the kidneys. The damage can be so bad that people need dialysis. If you're taking Rituximab for a cancer condition your doctor can give you medicines and take measures to prevent this reaction.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Rituximab can increase your risk of irregular heartbeat. Your doctor may test your heart and blood before starting treatment. If  the heart problems are serious, your doctor may stop Rituximab.

description_processed.orig: Rituximab can increase your risk of irregular heartbeat. Your doctor may test your heart and blood before starting treatment. If  the heart problems are serious, your doctor may stop Rituximab.

risks_warnings.title: Gastrointestinal problems
risks_warnings.description: Blockage or tearing of the bowel can happen early on (average is within 6 days) while taking Rituximab. If you develop belly pain with or without repeated vomiting, tell your doctor and get medical help right away.

description_processed.orig: Blockage or tearing of the bowel can happen early on (average is within 6 days) while taking Rituximab. If you develop belly pain with or without repeated vomiting, tell your doctor and get medical help right away.

risks_warnings.title: Blood problems
risks_warnings.description: Rituximab can affect blood cells that help you fight infection and stop bleeding. Let your doctor know if you develop a fever that doesn't go away, or you easily bruise, or bleed. You may need to stop taking this medicine.

description_processed.orig: Rituximab can affect blood cells that help you fight infection and stop bleeding. Let your doctor know if you develop a fever that doesn't go away, or you easily bruise, or bleed. You may need to stop taking this medicine.
